data.architecture:
## Platform Configuration Architecture

### Android Health Connect Integration
- **minSdk 26**: Required for Health Connect API availability
- **compileSdk 34**: Latest stable SDK for Health Connect features
- **Permissions**: READ_STEPS, WRITE_STEPS, ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION
- **activity-alias**: Required for permission rationale viewing
- **queries**: Package visibility for Health Connect app

### iOS HealthKit Integration
- **Deployment Target 12.0**: Required for health package compatibility
- **Entitlements**: com.apple.developer.healthkit with background-delivery
- **Usage Descriptions**: NSHealthShareUsageDescription, NSHealthUpdateUsageDescription, NSMotionUsageDescription
- **Capability**: HealthKit enabled in Xcode project settings

### File Structure
```
android/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ build.gradle (SDK versions, dependencies)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ src/main/
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AndroidManifest.xml (permissions, activity-alias)
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ kotlin/com/pasos/app/MainActivity.kt
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ res/xml/health_permissions.xml
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ build.gradle (buildscript, plugins)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ settings.gradle (plugin management)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ gradle.properties (JVM args, AndroidX)

ios/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Runner/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Info.plist (usage descriptions)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Runner.entitlements (HealthKit capability)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AppDelegate.swift
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Runner.xcodeproj/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ project.pbxproj (build settings)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ xcshareddata/xcschemes/Runner.xcscheme
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Podfile (Flutter pod integration)
```

### SOLID Compliance
- **SRP**: Each platform configuration file has single responsibility
- **OCP**: Platform configs can be extended without modifying core Flutter code
- **DIP**: Flutter health package abstracts platform-specific implementations

stories.title: Create Android folder structure with Health Connect permissions in AndroidManifest.xml
stories.description:
Create the complete Android folder structure and configure Health Connect permissions for step counting.

üîí **SCOPE BOUNDARY:**
- You can ONLY create files listed below
- Creating ANY other file is a scope violation

üìÅ **FILES:**
- Create: android/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml
- Create: android/app/src/main/res/xml/health_permissions.xml
- Create: android/app/src/main/kotlin/com/pasos/app/MainActivity.kt

üîß **PATTERNS TO USE:**
- Use standard Flutter Android project structure
- Health Connect requires activity-alias for permission handling
- Must include android.permission.ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION
- Must include android.permission.health.READ_STEPS
- Must include android.permission.health.WRITE_STEPS

üì¶ **REQUIRED CONFIGURATION:**

**AndroidManifest.xml must include:**
```xml
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.health.READ_STEPS"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.health.WRITE_STEPS"/>
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET"/>
    
    <application
        android:label="Pasos"
        android:name="${applicationName}"
        android:icon="@mipmap/ic_launcher">
        
        <activity android:name=".MainActivity" ...>
            <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN"/>
                <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER"/>
            </intent-filter>
        </activity>
        
        <!-- Health Connect permissions activity -->
        <activity-alias
            android:name="ViewPermissionUsageActivity"
            android:targetActivity=".MainActivity"
            android:exported="true"
            android:permission="android.permission.START_VIEW_PERMISSION_USAGE">
            <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="android.intent.action.VIEW_PERMISSION_USAGE"/>
                <category android:name="android.intent.category.HEALTH_PERMISSIONS"/>
            </intent-filter>
        </activity-alias>
        
        <meta-data
            android:name="health_permissions"
            android:resource="@xml/health_permissions"/>
    </application>
    
    <queries>
        <package android:name="com.google.android.apps.healthdata"/>
    </queries>
</manifest>
```

**health_permissions.xml must include:**
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<permissions>
    <permission-group android:name="android.permission-group.HEALTH">
        <permission android:name="android.permission.health.READ_STEPS"/>
        <permission android:name="android.permission.health.WRITE_STEPS"/>
        <permission android:name="android.permission.health.READ_TOTAL_CALORIES_BURNED"/>
        <permission android:name="android.permission.health.READ_DISTANCE"/>
    </permission-group>
</permissions>
```

**MainActivity.kt:**
```kotlin
package com.pasos.app

import io.flutter.embedding.android.FlutterActivity

class MainActivity: FlutterActivity()
```

‚ö†Ô∏è **ANTI-PATTERNS TO AVOID:**
- Do NOT use deprecated Google Fit permissions - use Health Connect
- Do NOT forget the queries tag for Health Connect package
- Do NOT skip the activity-alias for permission viewing
- Do NOT hardcode package name - use ${applicationId} where needed

üéØ **FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS:**
- AndroidManifest.xml properly declares all Health Connect permissions
- health_permissions.xml defines the permission group for health data
- MainActivity.kt extends FlutterActivity
- activity-alias enables Health Connect permission rationale viewing

üß™ **VERIFICATION:**
- Files created in correct directory structure
- XML syntax is valid (no parsing errors)
- All required permissions are declared
- Package name matches com.pasos.app
acceptanceCriteria: Given the Android folder structure is created, When building the Android app, Then Health Connect permissions are properly declared
Given AndroidManifest.xml exists, When Health Connect checks permissions, Then all step-related permissions are available
Given health_permissions.xml exists, When user views permission rationale, Then step permissions are listed
Given MainActivity.kt exists, When Flutter initializes, Then the Android activity starts correctly

stories.title: Create iOS folder structure with HealthKit capabilities in Info.plist and Runner.entitlements
stories.description:
Create the complete iOS folder structure and configure HealthKit capabilities for step tracking.

üîí **SCOPE BOUNDARY:**
- You can ONLY create files listed below
- Creating ANY other file is a scope violation

üìÅ **FILES:**
- Create: ios/Runner/Info.plist
- Create: ios/Runner/Runner.entitlements
- Create: ios/Runner/AppDelegate.swift

üîß **PATTERNS TO USE:**
- Use standard Flutter iOS project structure
- HealthKit requires entitlements file with capability enabled
- Info.plist must include NSHealthShareUsageDescription and NSHealthUpdateUsageDescription
- AppDelegate must extend FlutterAppDelegate

üì¶ **REQUIRED CONFIGURATION:**

**Info.plist must include:**
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
    <key>CFBundleDevelopmentRegion</key>
    <string>$(DEVELOPMENT_LANGUAGE)</string>
    <key>CFBundleDisplayName</key>
    <string>Pasos</string>
    <key>CFBundleExecutable</key>
    <string>$(EXECUTABLE_NAME)</string>
    <key>CFBundleIdentifier</key>
    <string>$(PRODUCT_BUNDLE_IDENTIFIER)</string>
    <key>CFBundleInfoDictionaryVersion</key>
    <string>6.0</string>
    <key>CFBundleName</key>
    <string>pasos</string>
    <key>CFBundlePackageType</key>
    <string>APPL</string>
    <key>CFBundleShortVersionString</key>
    <string>$(FLUTTER_BUILD_NAME)</string>
    <key>CFBundleSignature</key>
    <string>????</string>
    <key>CFBundleVersion</key>
    <string>$(FLUTTER_BUILD_NUMBER)</string>
    <key>LSRequiresIPhoneOS</key>
    <true/>
    <key>UILaunchStoryboardName</key>
    <string>LaunchScreen</string>
    <key>UIMainStoryboardFile</key>
    <string>Main</string>
    <key>UISupportedInterfaceOrientations</key>
    <array>
        <string>UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait</string>
        <string>UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft</string>
        <string>UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight</string>
    </array>
    <key>UIApplicationSupportsIndirectInputEvents</key>
    <true/>
    
    <!-- HealthKit Usage Descriptions -->
    <key>NSHealthShareUsageDescription</key>
    <string>Pasos needs access to your health data to read your step count and sync it with friends.</string>
    <key>NSHealthUpdateUsageDescription</key>
    <string>Pasos needs permission to save your step data to Apple Health.</string>
    <key>NSMotionUsageDescription</key>
    <string>Pasos uses motion sensors to count your steps when Health data is unavailable.</string>
</dict>
</plist>
```

**Runner.entitlements must include:**
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
    <key>com.apple.developer.healthkit</key>
    <true/>
    <key>com.apple.developer.healthkit.access</key>
    <array>
        <string>health-records</string>
    </array>
    <key>com.apple.developer.healthkit.background-delivery</key>
    <true/>
</dict>
</plist>
```

**AppDelegate.swift:**
```swift
import UIKit
import Flutter

@UIApplicationMain
@objc class AppDelegate: FlutterAppDelegate {
  override func application(
    _ application: UIApplication,
    didFinishLaunchingWithOptions launchOptions: [UIApplication.LaunchOptionsKey: Any]?
  ) -> Bool {
    GeneratedPluginRegistrant.register(with: self)
    return super.application(application, didFinishLaunchingWithOptions: launchOptions)
  }
}
```

‚ö†Ô∏è **ANTI-PATTERNS TO AVOID:**
- Do NOT forget NSHealthShareUsageDescription - app will crash on permission request
- Do NOT forget NSHealthUpdateUsageDescription - writing to HealthKit will fail
- Do NOT skip background-delivery entitlement for background sync
- Do NOT use generic/vague usage descriptions - be specific about step counting

üéØ **FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS:**
- Info.plist properly declares all HealthKit usage descriptions
- Runner.entitlements enables HealthKit capability with background delivery
- AppDelegate.swift extends FlutterAppDelegate correctly
- Usage descriptions clearly explain why step data access is needed

üß™ **VERIFICATION:**
- Files created in correct directory structure (ios/Runner/)
- XML/plist syntax is valid
- All required HealthKit keys are present
- AppDelegate compiles with Flutter imports
acceptanceCriteria: Given the iOS folder structure is created, When building the iOS app, Then HealthKit capability is enabled
Given Info.plist exists with usage descriptions, When app requests HealthKit permission, Then descriptive dialog is shown
Given Runner.entitlements exists, When HealthKit API is called, Then permission is properly scoped
Given AppDelegate.swift exists, When Flutter initializes, Then iOS app delegate starts correctly

stories.title: Create Android build.gradle files with minSdk 26 and Health Connect dependencies
acceptanceCriteria: Given build.gradle files exist, When running gradle sync, Then no dependency errors occur
Given minSdk is 26, When Health Connect is initialized, Then API is available
Given compileSdk is 34, When building, Then latest Android APIs are accessible
Given Kotlin plugin is configured, When compiling MainActivity, Then Kotlin compiles successfully

stories.title: Create iOS Xcode project structure with HealthKit capability configuration
stories.description:
Create the iOS Xcode project configuration files with HealthKit capability enabled.

üîí **SCOPE BOUNDARY:**
- You can ONLY create files listed below
- Creating ANY other file is a scope violation

üìÅ **FILES:**
- Create: ios/Runner.xcodeproj/project.pbxproj
- Create: ios/Runner.xcodeproj/xcshareddata/xcschemes/Runner.xcscheme
- Create: ios/Podfile

üîß **PATTERNS TO USE:**
- Use standard Flutter iOS Xcode project structure
- HealthKit capability must be added to build settings
- Minimum iOS deployment target should be 12.0 for health package
- Follow Flutter Podfile conventions

üì¶ **REQUIRED CONFIGURATION:**

**ios/Podfile:**
```ruby
# Uncomment the next line to define a global platform for your project
platform :ios, '12.0'

# CocoaPods analytics sends network stats synchronously affecting flutter build latency.
ENV['COCOAPODS_DISABLE_STATS'] = 'true'

project 'Runner', {
  'Debug' => :debug,
  'Profile' => :release,
  'Release' => :release,
}

def flutter_root
  generated_xcode_build_settings_path = File.expand_path(File.join('..', 'Flutter', 'Generated.xcconfig'), __FILE__)
  unless File.exist?(generated_xcode_build_settings_path)
    raise "#{generated_xcode_build_settings_path} must exist. If you're running pod install manually, make sure flutter pub get is executed first"
  end

  File.foreach(generated_xcode_build_settings_path) do |line|
    matches = line.match(/FLUTTER_ROOT\=(.*)$/)
    return matches[1].strip if matches
  end
  raise "FLUTTER_ROOT not found in #{generated_xcode_build_settings_path}. Try deleting Generated.xcconfig, then run flutter pub get"
end

require File.expand_path(File.join('packages', 'flutter_tools', 'bin', 'podhelper'), flutter_root)

flutter_ios_podfile_setup

target 'Runner' do
  use_frameworks!
  use_modular_headers!

  flutter_install_all_ios_pods File.dirname(File.realpath(__FILE__))
  
  target 'RunnerTests' do
    inherit! :search_paths
  end
end

post_install do |installer|
  installer.pods_project.targets.each do |target|
    flutter_additional_ios_build_settings(target)
    target.build_configurations.each do |config|
      config.build_settings['IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET'] = '12.0'
    end
  end
end
```

**ios/Runner.xcodeproj/xcshareddata/xcschemes/Runner.xcscheme:**
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Scheme
   LastUpgradeVersion = "1510"
   version = "1.7">
   <BuildAction
      parallelizeBuildables = "YES"
      buildImplicitDependencies = "YES">
      <BuildActionEntries>
         <BuildActionEntry
            buildForTesting = "YES"
            buildForRunning = "YES"
            buildForProfiling = "YES"
            buildForArchiving = "YES"
            buildForAnalyzing = "YES">
            <BuildableReference
               BuildableIdentifier = "primary"
               BlueprintIdentifier = "97C146ED1CF9000F007C117D"
               BuildableName = "Runner.app"
               BlueprintName = "Runner"
               ReferencedContainer = "container:Runner.xcodeproj">
            </BuildableReference>
         </BuildActionEntry>
      </BuildActionEntries>
   </BuildAction>
   <TestAction
      buildConfiguration = "Debug"
      selectedDebuggerIdentifier = "Xcode.DebuggerFoundation.Debugger.LLDB"
      selectedLauncherIdentifier = "Xcode.DebuggerFoundation.Launcher.LLDB"
      shouldUseLaunchSchemeArgsEnv = "YES"
      shouldAutocreateTestPlan = "YES">
   </TestAction>
   <LaunchAction
      buildConfiguration = "Debug"
      selectedDebuggerIdentifier = "Xcode.DebuggerFoundation.Debugger.LLDB"
      selectedLauncherIdentifier = "Xcode.DebuggerFoundation.Launcher.LLDB"
      launchStyle = "0"
      useCustomWorkingDirectory = "NO"
      ignoresPersistentStateOnLaunch = "NO"
      debugDocumentVersioning = "YES"
      debugServiceExtension = "internal"
      allowLocationSimulation = "YES">
      <BuildableProductRunnable
         runnableDebuggingMode = "0">
         <BuildableReference
            BuildableIdentifier = "primary"
            BlueprintIdentifier = "97C146ED1CF9000F007C117D"
            BuildableName = "Runner.app"
            BlueprintName = "Runner"
            ReferencedContainer = "container:Runner.xcodeproj">
         </BuildableReference>
      </BuildableProductRunnable>
   </LaunchAction>
   <ProfileAction
      buildConfiguration = "Profile"
      shouldUseLaunchSchemeArgsEnv = "YES"
      savedToolIdentifier = ""
      useCustomWorkingDirectory = "NO"
      debugDocumentVersioning = "YES">
      <BuildableProductRunnable
         runnableDebuggingMode = "0">
         <BuildableReference
            BuildableIdentifier = "primary"
            BlueprintIdentifier = "97C146ED1CF9000F007C117D"
            BuildableName = "Runner.app"
            BlueprintName = "Runner"
            ReferencedContainer = "container:Runner.xcodeproj">
         </BuildableReference>
      </BuildableProductRunnable>
   </ProfileAction>
   <AnalyzeAction
      buildConfiguration = "Debug">
   </AnalyzeAction>
   <ArchiveAction
      buildConfiguration = "Release"
      revealArchiveInOrganizer = "YES">
   </ArchiveAction>
</Scheme>
```

**ios/Runner.xcodeproj/project.pbxproj:**
Create a standard Flutter iOS project.pbxproj with:
- IPHONEOS_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET = 12.0
- CODE_SIGN_ENTITLEMENTS = Runner/Runner.entitlements
- PRODUCT_BUNDLE_IDENTIFIER = com.pasos.app
- HealthKit framework linked
- Proper build configurations (Debug, Release, Profile)

‚ö†Ô∏è **ANTI-PATTERNS TO AVOID:**
- Do NOT set deployment target below 12.0 - health package requires it
- Do NOT forget to reference Runner.entitlements in build settings
- Do NOT skip the HealthKit framework linking
- Do NOT use hardcoded signing identities

üéØ **FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS:**
- Minimum deployment target is iOS 12.0
- HealthKit capability is referenced in project settings
- Podfile properly configured for Flutter integration
- Build scheme supports Debug, Release, and Profile configurations
- Entitlements file is referenced in CODE_SIGN_ENTITLEMENTS

üß™ **VERIFICATION:**
- project.pbxproj has valid PBX syntax
- Podfile has valid Ruby syntax
- Deployment target >= 12.0 is configured
- Entitlements file reference exists in build settings
acceptanceCriteria: Given project.pbxproj exists, When Xcode opens the project, Then no configuration errors occur
Given Podfile exists, When running pod install, Then Flutter pods are installed correctly
Given deployment target is 12.0, When health package initializes, Then APIs are available
Given entitlements are referenced, When HealthKit permission is requested, Then proper entitlements are used
